result.execSummary:
The defendant Olivia D Stapleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Per 1/2/18 Order: The Judgment of Conviction is ordered to be modified to reflect 4 days of sentence credit.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution to Lindsay Ritter in the amount of $2,860

--to pay restitution to Laborer's Health Fund in the amount of $2,670
--maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

--no contact with Lindsay Ritter

--no acts or threats of violence

--not to consume any alcohol 

--no presence in bars or taverns

--not to possess or consume any non prescribed controlled substances, without a valid prescription and then taken only as prescribed

The Court grants expungement upon successful completion of probation,  the Court orders that in order for Ms. Stapleton to receive the expungement there must be no early discharge from probation, the Court will expunge if all restitution to Ms. Ritter is paid, but restitution remains in owing to Laborer's Health Fund.

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--to comply with DNA sample provision 

Arresting Agency: Jefferson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

supervisions.notes: Upon inquiry of the Clerk, the Court confirms that It was/is Its intent to adopt DOCs recommendation re: outstanding costs/fees/surcharges and restitution and they are all to be converted to a civil judgment

[ma] Case called at 9:02 AM 
Defendant Olivia D Stapleton in court, in custody with Attorney Scott Harold Southworth.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant verifies name; provides date of birth
The Court verifies receipt and review of JOC, Plea & Sentencing Transcript, and Revocation Packet from DOC

Sentencing Recommendations given by Counsel 
Statement made by Ms. Stapleton

The Court adopts DOC recommendation.

On Count #1: The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to any other sentence in being, otherwise FORTHWITH

On Count #2: The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served concurrent to the sentence in Count #1, but consecutive to any other sentence in being.

88 days credit for time already served given

Ms. Stapleton is ordered to report and serve the sentence with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in her system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.

The Court authorizes transfer of sentence to another county, so long as it is served without electronic monitoring.

[[Post Heraing/Off Record: Upon inquiry of the Clerk, the Court confirms that It was/is Its intent to adopt DOCs recommendation re: outstanding costs/fees/surcharges and restitution and they are all to be converted to a civil judgment]]

[MA]Case called at 11:16am
Defendant Olivia D Stapleton in court with Attorney Teri Strohschein.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Shock submits victim impact statement

On Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--no contact with Lindsay Ritter
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--not to consume any alcohol 
--no presence in bars or taverns
--not to possess or consume any non prescribed controlled substances, without a valid prescription and then taken only as prescribed
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay restitution to Lindsay Ritter in the amount of $2,860
--to pay restitution to Laborer's Health Fund in the amount of $2,670
--to pay court costs/fees/surcharges/assessments 

The Court grants expungement upon successful completion of probation,  the Court orders that in order for Ms. Stapleton to receive the expungement there must be no early discharge from probation, the Court will expunge if all restitution to Ms. Ritter is paid, but restitution remains in owing to Laborer's Health Fund.

Atty. Strohschein will submit a stipulation regarding sentence credit. 
recess: 11:38am

[MA]Case called at 2:54pm
Defendant Olivia D Stapleton in court.  Law Student Maura Falk appearing under the supervision of Monica J. Hall  for the State of Wisconsin.
Ms. Stapleton indicates that she wishes  the case to be scheduled for plea and sentencing, wishes to enter a plea.

Upon inquiry of the Court, Ms. Stapleton indicates that she has decided to go without counsel; after further discussion between Ms. Stapleton and the Court, the Court directs Ms. Stapleton to the PD office to seek representation

The Court directs the Clerk to provide Ms. Stapleton with Petition for Court Appointed Counsel and Waiver of Attorney forms to review prior to next hearing.

Defendant Olivia D Stapleton in court.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BY THE COURT: Request is denied as the defendant was already given a 60 day adjournment on 3-10-17 and because this request was not timely filed. Further, no reasonable basis has been offered which would justify and adjournment fo this case which is almost 2 years old - RRK

Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV:
[MK] case called at 2:36pm. 
Defendant Olivia D Stapleton in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews right to counsel. 
Ms. Stapleton indicates that she intends to retain private counsel; she wishes to look into the case from the very beginning with a private attorney. She feels that a 45 day length is sufficient to do this.
Ms. Stapleton makes a statement about the difficulties this case has caused her with obtaining employment and related to being incarcerated, paying a portion of the restitution amount through the First Offender Program, and with receiving a notice of civil-litigation from an attorney that is representing the victim in this case. 
DA Happ clarifies that the First Offender Program is no longer an available option for Ms. Stapleton.
The Court emphasizes to Ms. Stapleton that if she finds that she cannot afford to hire counsel, she should apply at the Public Defenders Office before the next hearing. 
Ms. Stapleton verifies that the 1916 13th Drive, Friendship WI address is current. 
The Court continues the already-posted $150 Cash Bond with conditions; the Court reviews the Bond conditions that are in effect with Ms. Stapleton.
recess 2:42pm.

Case called at 1:20pm [mo]
[Hearing on Failure to Appear at Adjourned Initial Appearance]
Defendant Olivia D Stapleton appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint  appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney Hagemann indicates that Ms. Stapleton is eligible for SPD representation
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court verifies the Defendant's name, date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Bond Arguments given by Counsel
The Court requires a $150 CASH bond, with conditions as previously imposed. 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances
-Take all prescription drugs as prescribed
-No contact with Lindsay Ritter  
-No discussion of case with Tyler Dokken
-Booking at JCSD
recess 1:24  pm.
